cleaned_text: Eating Tips How to Get Vitamin D 8 Easy Ways to Get Vitamin D ASAP February 10, 2017 by Dominique Michelle Astorino Image Source: POPSUGAR Photography / Sheila Gim Do you have enough vitamin D? It's a little tougher to maintain your levels in the wintertime or if you work indoors (as many of us do!). Vitamin D keeps your bones strong, can boost energy levels, fights infection and disease, aids in weight loss, and might even fight depression. If you've been achy, fatigued, or struggling with weight loss or have had a mood imbalance, it's time to assess your vitamin D levels. Check with your doctor, but make sure you're getting some time outside and eating the right foods. Here's what you need to do! Related: 9 Steps You Can Take Today to Manage Your Seasonal Depression Get Some Sun Image Source: POPSUGAR Photography / Ericka McConnell The easiest way to absorb vitamin D naturally is by getting some (safe!) sun exposure. If you live in a particularly gloomy area, consider investing in a UV light for some at-home UV therapy. 1 / 9 Drink Milk Image Source: POPSUGAR Photography / Jae Payne Fortified milk contains high levels of vitamin D. A little splash in your coffee or morning oatmeal can go a long way. 2 / 9 Try Fortified Cereal Image Source: POPSUGAR Photography / Erin Cullum Some cereals are also fortified with vitamin D. Choose a nutritious, low-sugar option to make this breakfast staple a little healthier. 3 / 9 Eat Fatty Fish Image Source: POPSUGAR Photography / Lizzie Fuhr Salmon and other fatty fishes are rich in vitamin D. Make a grilled salmon dinner or try mackerel or herring. 4 / 9 Make Some Eggs Image Source: POPSUGAR Photography / Jae Payne The egg yolk is loaded in sunny vitamin D, so don't opt for egg whites this time. Make scrambled eggs in the morning or hard-boiled eggs for afternoon snacks. 5 / 9 Crack Open Canned Tuna Image Source: POPSUGAR Photography / Lizzie Fuhr Canned tuna in particular is one of the best and easiest ways to eat your vitamin D, and there are so many delicious canned tuna recipes. It's also very inexpensive! 6 / 9 Supplement With Cod Liver Oil Image Source: POPSUGAR Photography / Annie Gabillet While it might not sound super appetizing, cod liver oil supplements offer bioavailable vitamin D that your body is able to absorb quickly. 7 / 9 Look For Fortified Orange Juice Image Source: POPSUGAR Photography / Jae Payne While not every orange juice out there has vitamin D, it's also not hard to find a fortified option that contains the nutrients you need. Peep the labels the next time you're grocery shopping to ensure you're getting all the right vitamins. 8 / 9 And If All Else Fails . . . Image Source: POPSUGAR Photography / THEM TOO Opt for a supplement. Discuss with your doctor first, but you should be able to find the right supplement in your local grocery store or natural market. 9 / 9 Healthy
